I don't leave comments on YouTube,  but I found your music around November of 2017 just a couple of months after hurricane Harvey.  I live in Dickinson, Texas which was effected dramatically by the storm.  My family and I lived through one of the worst storms I can remember in my 42 years.  We're still recovering and putting or lives back together; I just wanted to say thank you for emulating the love and courage or citizens showed one another during a time of true crises. You let the world know that the Bay Area is a community that cares. 

Thank You.

I have been listening to your music, and watching you come up. Your tunes are glorious!, to say the least. You are very talented. No music strikes me like yours. I love Beethoven and Mozart, however; you bring qualities in to music that are never before heard of and completely groundbreaking in my opinion. Your music literally has a positive effect on my brain. I instantly know it's you as soon as one of your songs begin. Then I have to tell my friends about you and gave them sample your symphony. THEN, they all start listening to you.

The beginning screen hit me really hard.
Puerto Rico ğŸ˜­ğŸ’”
My younger sister Iris and my dear twin nieces were nearly swept away in the raging waters and winds that pounded the beautiful island and it people September 20th. I nearly lost part of my dear family there. They were finally able to contact me about three weeks later with a borrowed mobile phone. They had been rescued and in a homeless shelter. They lost nearly everything.
Thank you God for saving them and many others.
My heart goes out to the families who lost loved ones.
Thank you to all the helpers, responders and people who now still help Puerto Rico.
A special thank you to Jessica Medina-Escobar
